result.execSummary:
The defendant Hank A Hammac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (1/29/16).
Must follow rules of Probation.

miscConds.notes: $263.50 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond posted in 15CM373, 15CM374 & 15CM412 to be applied to fine/costs with any remaining balance to be returned to poster.

Must provide DNA sample and pay a $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office.
Must complete a Domestic Abuse assessment and pay a $100.00 Domestic Abuse surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office.  
Bond posted in 15CM373, 15CM374 & 15CM412 to be applied to fine/costs with any remaining balance to be returned to poster.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No contact with Jessica Hammac is subject to provisions of other court and as set forth by Probation.

timeConds.notes: Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hank A Hammac
